Method Detail

greedyExec

public static void greedyExec(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display d,
                              java.lang.Runnable r)
Runs the given runnable on the given display as soon as possible. If possible, the runnable will be executed before the next widget is repainted, but this behavior is not guaranteed. Use this method to schedule work will affect the way one or more widgets are drawn.

This is threadsafe.

Parameters:
d - display
r - runnable to execute in the UI thread.

runOnce

public static void runOnce(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display d,
                           java.lang.Runnable r)
Runs the given runnable on the given display as soon as possible. Unlike greedyExec, this has no effect if the given runnable has already been scheduled for execution. Use this method to schedule work that will affect the way one or more wigdets are drawn, but that should only happen once.

This is threadsafe.

Parameters:
d - display
r - runnable to execute in the UI thread. Has no effect if the given runnable has already been scheduled but has not yet run.

cancelExec

public static void cancelExec(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display d,
                              java.lang.Runnable r)
Cancels a greedyExec or runOnce that was previously scheduled on the given display. Has no effect if the given runnable is not in the queue for the given display

Parameters:
d - target display
r - runnable to execute

mix

public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.RGB mix(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.RGB rgb1,
                                               org.eclipse.swt.graphics.RGB rgb2,
                                               double ratio)
Parameters:
rgb1 -
rgb2 -
ratio -
Returns:
the RGB object

logException

public static void logException(java.lang.Exception t)
Logs an exception as though it was thrown by a SafeRunnable being run with the default ISafeRunnableRunner. Will not open modal dialogs or spin the event loop.

Parameters:
t - throwable to log
